docs.snippet: Senator Chuck Schumer, a Democrat, and Wendy E. Long, his Republican challenger, often appeared to be fighting for the candidates at the top of the ticket as often as discussing their own differences....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Chuck Schumer, a Democrat, and Wendy E. Long, his Republican challenger, often appeared to be fighting for the candidates at the top of the ticket as often as discussing their own differences.
docs.abstract: Incumbent Sen Chuck Schumer of New York and Republican  challenger Wendy E Long spend as much time during NY1-sponsored debate defending each party's presidential nominee as they do presenting their own positions on issues.

headline.main: New York Senate Debate Becomes Proxy War for Presidential Hopefuls
headline.print_headline: In Senate Debate, a Proxy War for Presidential Hopefuls

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called Democratic rival Hillary Clinton a threat to the country on Monday, saying that if she is elected a probe into her emails could shadow her entire term in office, as the latest Reuters/Ipsos pol...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called Democratic rival Hillary Clinton a threat to the country on Monday, saying that if she is elected a probe into her emails could shadow her entire term in office, as the latest Reuters/Ipsos poll showed Clinton's lead narrowing slightly.

headline.main: Trump Raises Specter of Crisis if Clinton Wins the White House

docs.snippet: Want to watch returns with a few hundred strangers? Movie houses across the country are making plans to show results live....

docs.abstract: Movie theater chains AMC Theaters, Regal Cinemas and Alama Drafthouse Cinema are planning to show election-night news coverage on their screens across United States; will not charge admission.

headline.main: Theaters Open Doors for an Election Worthy of the Big Screen

docs.snippet: Democratic Party officials sued Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump in four battleground states on Monday, seeking to shut down a poll-watching effort they said was designed to harass minority voters in the Nov. 8 election....
